intro: Lappula calycosa, commonly known as the calycous lappula, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae, which includes species adapted to arid environments. The plant has small, green, leafy stems with clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a slightly succulent texture, aiding in water retention. Lappula calycosa is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in certain ecosystems.
